definition: Mikolaj Kopernik or Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543), Polish astronomer, mathematician and polymath
elder brother
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)

sentences.english: This principle was important in helping to support the Copernican theory.
sentences.chinese: 这一原理对解释哥白尼理论非常重要。

sentences.english: It was not until 1543 that an alternative model was put forward by Copernicus.
sentences.chinese: 直到1543年，哥白尼才提出一个可替代模型。

sentences.english: Copernicus Revolution is an important part of Kants Critique of Pure Reason.
sentences.chinese: 康德“哥白尼革命”是其批判哲学的重要一环。

sentences.english: The final triumph of this idea is commonly called the Copernicus Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 日心说思想的最终胜利普遍被称为哥白尼革命。

sentences.english: A generation after Copernicus, Galileo (1564-1642) proved that Copernicus was right.
sentences.chinese: 继哥白尼之后，伽利略证明哥白尼是对的。

sentences.english: A generation after Copernicus, Galileo (1564-1642) proved that Copernicus was right.
sentences.chinese: 继哥白尼之后，伽利略证明哥白尼是对的。

sentences.english: The first one is embodied by his Copernican revolution.
sentences.chinese: 第一个环节集中体现在海舍尔的哥白尼式革命上。

sentences.english: Copernicus was terribly persecuted for his scientific theory.
sentences.chinese: 哥白尼由于其科学理论而遭到严重的迫害。

sentences.english: Copernicus concluded that the earth went round the sun.
sentences.chinese: 哥白尼断定地球围日公阳旋转。

sentences.english: Copernicus taught astronomy at the University of Rome for a few years.
sentences.chinese: 哥白尼在罗马大学教授了几年天文学。

sentences.english: He described the remarkable breakthrough as ‘fulfilling the dreams of Copernicus’.
sentences.chinese: 他把这个重要的发现描述为“实现了哥白尼的梦想”。
